curam.util.workflow.impl
Interface TaskAssignmentChecker

public interface TaskAssignmentChecker

The TaskAssignmentChecker callback interface is implemented in the application to define what should happen when a task has not been allocated to any user or work queue after the work resolver has been called for that task.

The workflow engine will retrieve the out-of-the-box TaskAssignmentChecker implementation class via reflection and call the associated checkTaskAssignment function to check if the task has been allocated to any user on the system. If it has not, the task will be assigned to the default work queue for workflow.

Method Summary
 void checkTaskAssignment(TaskDetails taskDetails)
          Checks to see if the task has been assigned after the work resolver has been called to allocate the task.
 

Method Detail

checkTaskAssignment

void checkTaskAssignment(TaskDetails taskDetails)
                         throws AppException,
                                InformationalException
Checks to see if the task has been assigned after the work resolver has been called to allocate the task. If not, then the task is assigned to the default work queue that has been specified for workflow.

Parameters:
taskDetails - The details of the task whose assignment status is required to be checked.
Throws:
AppException - Exceptions that may occur when checking the assignment of a task.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
